comments.body: This worries me. A naive developer (me, for instance) wanting to start hacking on NumPy could forget to install Cython into their virtualenv, this could potentially get the one from the OS which may be too old. Couldn't we just remove this?

I agree this is a little worrisome, but before this patch, it would always do this - at least now if you do create the virtualenv, you get correct behavior.

I don't want to change this in a way that will break existing users building from source in a non-obvious way, which removing the call to the system `cython` would do. Emitting a warning would be reasonable, but I'd like to leave that to a future PR.

comments.body: Python 3.7 requires > 0.28, We pinned to .26 for Python 3.6 wheels on windows, etc. Trying to sort out the dependencies would be a hassle. The problem we have here is that lgtm is stuck on an older cython version and we don't have a way to upgrade it.
Travis had issues with cython 0.28 too. I want to leave bumping that version to a separate pr (#11484), which I will come back to after this one.
